result.execSummary:
The defendant Mykel L Farr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 8/25/2017, or serve 15 days in the House of Correction.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 29 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work and work search.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 29 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work and work search.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 8/25/2017, or serve 15 days in the House of Correction.   

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

BRANCH 47 FOR BRANCH 4

Defendant Mykel L Farr in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Mykel L Farr in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Defendant changes his plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Scott Paley Phillips in court, defendant Mykel L Farr not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant in custody not produced, appearance waived.  Case calendared for bail/bond hearing.  Defense requests projected guilty plea hearing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mykel L Farr in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Mykel L Farr in custody.  Mark Patrick Dooley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk;  BN
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016, case is assigned to the Honorable Hannah Dugan, Branch 31 in Room 622 of the Courthouse.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

No reply from defendant or surety.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($850.00) gj
Court DENIED defendant's motion.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. Court ordered any bail forfeited.

Defendant Mykel L Farr in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered the stayed bench warrant canceled.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a motion hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
MOTION TO SUPPRESS PHYSICAL EVIDENCE-ILLEGAL STOP, SEARCH, AND SEIZURE.

Defendant Mykel L Farr in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a motion hearing date.  Court ordered any motions due by July 29, 2015.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Mykel L Farr in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defense counsel needs time to review discovery with the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Mykel L Farr in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Mykel L Farr in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
